paint.shared.utils

Class PaintPrefs

  • java.lang.Object
    • paint.shared.utils.PaintPrefs

  • public final class PaintPrefs
extends Object
    Provides static, thread-safe access to application preferences for Glyco-PAINT.

    Preferences are stored in ~/Library/Preferences/Glyco-PAINT.plist using Appleâ€™s Property List (plist) format. The class handles reading, writing, and automatic persistence of key-value pairs for various data types.

    • Thread-safe access (synchronized methods)
    • Automatic saving of preferences after updates
    • Reload capability for external modifications
    • Fallback to default values if keys are missing

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean getBoolean(String section, String key, boolean defaultValue)
      Retrieves a boolean preference value or writes the given default if not present.
      static String getString(String section, String key, String defaultValue)
      Retrieves a string preference value or writes the given default if missing.
      static void putBoolean(String key, boolean value)
      Stores a boolean at the top-level (no section) and persists it.
      static void putBoolean(String section, String key, boolean value)
      Stores a boolean value within a named section and persists the change.
      static void putInt(String key, int value)
      Stores an integer at the top-level (no section) and persists it.
      static void putString(String key, String value)
      Stores a string at the top-level (no section) and persists it.
      static void putString(String section, String key, String value)
      Stores a string value within a named section and persists the change.
      static void reload()
      Reloads preferences from disk, replacing the in-memory dictionary.

                                 String key,

        key - preference key
        defaultValue - default to return and store if missing

        stored boolean or default

      • reload

        public static void reload()
        Reloads preferences from disk, replacing the in-memory dictionary. If loading fails, resets to a new empty dictionary.
